 it did raise awareness of the subject and

for EVP.  Overall, I'd like to think it=

Margaret

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV>Thanks Margaret... I want to see White Noise I will have to rent the DVD.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Kay<BR><BR>--- On <B>Fri, 2/13/09, itcdeadpeople <I><ITCdeadpeople@...></I></B> wrote:<BR></DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...><BR>Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: New TV show<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Friday, February 13, 2009, 3:27 PM<BR><BR><PRE>I agree, Kay.  My DVR is set.  There have the snake oil types, or
rotten apples in the barrel, in most every field of work/research for
eons.  All we can hope for is minimal damage and maximum benefit.

For example, I didn't care, at all, for the negative slant the movie
White Noise put on ITC.  But it did raise awareness of the subject and
the DVD had great bonus features on it showing people how to record
for EVP.  Overall, I'd like to think it was a plus for the field.

Margaret
